title: Send Buildkite events to Observability Platform

import EventsToken from '/snippets/_partials/events-token.mdx';

{/* -- dri: Garrett Guillotte -- */}


To send Buildkite events to Chronosphere Observability Platform, create a webhook
within Buildkite and include your API key to authenticate with Observability
Platform.

## Obtain an API token

Before sending events from Buildkite, contact [Chronosphere Support](/support) to
obtain an API token for use with authenticating your third-party app with
Observability Platform.

<EventsToken />

## Create a Buildkite webhook

To send Buildkite events to Observability Platform:

1. In Buildkite, go to
   `https://buildkite.com/organizations/COMPANY/services`
   and [create a webhook](https://buildkite.com/docs/apis/webhooks).

   Replace _`COMPANY`_ with the name of your company or organization.
1. Click **Add Webhook** to define a webhook.
1. Enter a description for the webhook, such as **Chronosphere Buildkite**.
1. In the **URL** field, enter
   `https://ADDRESS.chronosphere.io/api/v1/data/events/receiver/buildkite`.

   Replace _`ADDRESS`_ with your company name prefixed to your Observability Platform
   instance that ends in `.chronosphere.io`. For example,
   _`MY_COMPANY`_`.chronosphere.io`.
1. In the **Token** field, enter the API token you obtained from Chronosphere
   Support.
1. Select **Send an HMAC signature**.
1. Select one or more of the following options for your webhook:
   - **build.finished**
   - **build.running**
   - **build.scheduled**
1. Select which pipelines you want to enable events for.
1. Save your webhook.
